did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: St. Ambrose Church of Greece parish record book, 1848-1860.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The parish register includes records of baptisms, marriage records, and death records.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The first church was built in 1829 and was the first Catholic Church erected in a rural area in the State of New York. The church was commonly called the "Church in the Wood." The church was opened for divine service by Father O'Donaghue who celebrated the first mass and dedicated the church to St. Ambrose. A resident priest was assigned to the church in 1840. A brick structure was constructed in 1859-60 and the new building was dedicated on September 16, 1860 to The Mother of Seven Sorrows. In recent years, the church has been known as Mother of Seven Sorrows Roman Catholic Church.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The parish register includes records of baptisms (1848-1860); marriage records (1849-1860); and death records (1849-1860).

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Not to be published or otherwise released in such form that any individual mentioned in the records can be identified.
